snippet: The Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday replaced a system that officials described as confusing and outdated with a clearer, more consistent explanation of dangers.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration updates system of how drug companies must explain dangers of taking medicine during pregnancy and while breast-feeding; doctors say current system, developed in 1970s and using letters of alphabet to indicate levels of risk, is too vague.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday replaced a system that officials described as confusing and outdated with a clearer, more consistent explanation of dangers.

headline.main: F.D.A. Revamps System Explaining the Risks of Medicines During Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Updates System Explaining the Dangers of Medicines Taken During Pregnancy
